content: I am a third-year Electronics & Communication Engineering undergrad from Chennai. I have hands-on experience with MATLAB, Python, C/C++, and Cadence, and have worked on projects involving signal processing, network protocols, and embedded systems.

Introduction #Attendance tracking has become an essential aspect of schools, colleges, and workplaces.
Traditional methods, such as passing attendance sheets, are time-consuming, prone to errors, and vulnerable to fake entries or data loss.
To overcome these limitations, modern solutions leverage technology like RFID, biometrics, NFC, Bluetooth, and barcode systems. Among these, RFID-based attendance systems are reliable, secure, and efficient.
This project demonstrates an RFID Attendance Management System using Arduino Uno, designed to automate attendance logging, improve efficiency, and reduce manual errors.
System Overview #When a registered RFID card is scanned:
‚úÖ Green LED + Short buzzer tone ‚Üí Attendance recorded successfully. ‚ùå Red LED + Long buzzer tone ‚Üí Invalid/unregistered card detected. The system also logs attendance data with date, time, and user details in real-time, which can be exported to Excel or a database for reporting.
Hardware Setup #Arduino Uno ‚Äì Microcontroller for system control. RFID RC522 Module ‚Äì Reads RFID cards. LEDs (Green & Red) ‚Äì Visual feedback. Buzzer ‚Äì Audio feedback. Wiring Connections #SDA ‚Üí Pin 10 SCK ‚Üí Pin 13 MOSI ‚Üí Pin 11 MISO ‚Üí Pin 12 RST ‚Üí Pin 9 Green LED ‚Üí Pin 5 Red LED ‚Üí Pin 6 Buzzer ‚Üí Pin 7 Software Implementation #Arduino communicates with the RFID module using SPI protocol. The system continuously checks for new RFID cards. Each card‚Äôs UID (Unique Identifier) is compared with stored valid IDs. Attendance is logged in the format: Attendance Logging #Valid card ‚Üí Record stored with timestamp. Invalid card ‚Üí Rejected with feedback. Data can be displayed on the Serial Monitor or exported to Excel/database for reporting. DATA, Date, Time, Name, UserNumber RFID RC522 Pin Configuration #Pin No. Name Description 1 VCC Power supply (3.3V) 2 RST Reset pin 3 GND Ground 4 IRQ Interrupt pin (wake-up signal) 5 MISO/SCL/TX MISO for SPI, SCL for I¬≤C, TX for UART 6 MOSI Master Out Slave In (SPI) 7 SCK Serial Clock (SPI) 8 SS/SDA/RX SS for SPI, SDA for I¬≤C, RX for UART Results #‚úÖ Automated attendance logging achieved. ‚úÖ Real-time validation with LED + buzzer feedback. ‚úÖ Data export possible for reporting and analysis. Conclusion #This RFID-based Attendance Management System provides a secure, efficient, and user-friendly solution for managing attendance in schools, colleges, offices, and events.
It simplifies the traditional process while reducing errors and improving overall operational efficiency.
